definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)

sentences.english: Her tears washed away the paint from her face.
sentences.chinese: 泪水把她脸上的脂粉都冲掉了。

sentences.english: The force of this surging water is enough to rip your facemask off.
sentences.chinese: 高涨海水的力量足以冲掉你的面罩。

sentences.english: The rain then falling wiped away all the footprints.
sentences.chinese: 那时下着雨，把所有的脚印都冲掉了。

sentences.english: The sweat of labour washed away his bureaucratic [official] airs.
sentences.chinese: 劳动的汗水冲掉了他身上的官气。

sentences.english: If the wind has not swept away any loose soil, the water has washed it away. Yes, good land for camels, perhaps.
sentences.chinese: 如果风没有吹走松动的泥土，水也会把它冲掉。

sentences.english: The force of the water would quickly wash it away.
sentences.chinese: 水流的力量会很快将它们冲掉。

sentences.english: The sweat of labour washed away his bureaucratic airs.
sentences.chinese: 劳动的汗水冲掉了他身上的官气。

sentences.english: He rinsed the teapot out under the tap , to get rid of the tea-leaves.
sentences.chinese: 他在水龙头下面冲洗茶壶，以便把茶叶冲掉。

definition: to moisten/to dampen/to be steeped in/to be imbued with
to scrape off/to shave off (whiskers etc)/(of the wind) to blow sth away
to skim froth or foam from the surface of a liquid
to emit bubbles/to bubble/to foam (with rage)/to seethe
